result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony A. GROOTHOFF was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Schedule IV Drugs (Diazepam), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Defendant is not to possess any prescription drug without a valid prescription and as prescribed by his own physician.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: consecutive to his prison sentences on 15 CF 591 and 16 CF 208.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is not to possess any prescription drug without a valid prescription and as prescribed by his own physician.

Maintain full-time employment,work search combination.   
Obtain GED/HSED.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Pay restitution of $722.44 to Wells Fargo Bank, Atten: Kay, 1718 West Park Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 and $21.42 to Mastercard, Associated Bank, 433 Main Street, MS 8499, Green Bay, WI 54301

timeConds.notes: Perform 60 hours of community service work.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Minutes.
RE:  Deliver schedule IV drug (Diazepam), on 04-01-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony theft and deliver schedule IV narcotics.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-19-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 recognizance bond.  Bail furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
